title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7823.3 - Responsibilities of the Office of General Services and public authorities
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7823.3 - Responsibilities of the Office of General Services and public authorities

State Regulations
(a) In fiscal years
commencing on and after April 1, 1981, the Office of General Services and each
public authority shall ensure that passenger automobiles acquired by all State
agencies and by each such public authority, respectively, achieve the
applicable average fuel economy prescribed in section
7823.4
of this Part. (b) The average fuel economy for passenger
automobiles acquired by State agencies shall be determined by adding the total
number of passenger automobiles acquired in a fiscal year by such State
agencies and dividing the total by a sum of terms, each term of which is a
fraction created by dividing (1) the number of passenger automobiles so
acquired of a given model type by (2) the rated fuel economy of such model
type. (c) The average fuel economy
for each public authority shall be determined by dividing the total number of
passenger automobiles acquired in a fiscal year by such public authority by a
sum of terms, each term of which is a fraction created by dividing (1) the
number of passenger automobiles so acquired of a given model type by (2) the
rated fuel economy of such model type. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
7823.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
